intro: Psydrax attenuatus var. tenellus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psidium, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid climate for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
